A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Twists and Turns for the very sake of twists and turns. Don't tell me Jhonson is creative or innovative. There's not any new idea in this movie (bedise the force-skype conversation). But the total lack of them hidden by twists and turns. In the end it's always the same story. But told via mind tricks. As a stand alone\, one may ever find it entertaining. I didn't. But... De gustibus non disputandum est. In the context of a trilogy it's a total waste of time.
